head.title: A VOTE FOR A HOTEL CHAIN

hedline.hl1: A VOTE FOR A HOTEL CHAIN

abstract.p: Elliot J Moritz letter on Michelle Higgins' travel article on budget hotels in Europe; praises Spain's Apsis Hotels chain

block.p: To the Editor: ''Budget Hotels in Europe: A Little Style, a Little Room and a Little Price'' by Michelle Higgins prompted me to inform your readers about Apsis Hotels, a small Spanish chain. There are seven hotels in Barcelona, one in Madrid, two in Girona, two in Andorra and one in Luchon, France.

My wife and I recently stayed at the Gran Ducat, a centrally located hotel off the Plaza Catalunya and La Rambla. Our four-night stay was about $450. The rooms were very small, but had private facilities. We were upgraded to a Comfort Room which was in the rear of the hotel and less noisy.

There are seven hotels in Barcelona, one in Madrid, two in Girona, two in Andorra and one in Luchon, France.

My wife and I recently stayed at the Gran Ducat, a centrally located hotel off the Plaza Catalunya and La Rambla. Our four-night stay was about $450. The rooms were very small, but had private facilities. We were upgraded to a Comfort Room which was in the rear of the hotel and less noisy.
The hotel was a real bargain at a little over $100 a night. Barcelona can be expensive as the dollar continues to fall against the euro.
Elliot J. Moritz Chestnut Ridge, N.Y.
